intro: Atragene iliensis, commonly known as the Ili Valley bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous regions, preferring well-drained soils. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces showy blooms during the summer months. Atragene iliensis is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
